    <us-gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Interim Financial 
Information &lt;/i&gt;&amp;#150;&#13;The accompanying consolidated financial 
statements have been prepared by Stack-it Storage, Inc., formerly, Caprock Oil, 
Inc. (&amp;#147;we&amp;#148;,&#13;&amp;#147;our&amp;#148; 
or&amp;#160;&amp;#160;the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;), without audit, in 
accordance with accounting principles generally accepted&#13;in the Unites 
States of America for interim financial information and pursuant to the rules 
and regulations of the Securities and&#13;Exchange 
Commission.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In the opinion of management, these consolidated 
financial statements contain all adjustments,&#13;consisting only of normal 
recurring adjustments, necessary to fairly state the financial position of the 
Company as of June 30,&#13;2015, the results of its operations for the three 
month and six month periods ended June 30, 2015 and 2014, and cash flows 
for&#13;the three month and six month periods ended June 30, 2015 and 
2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Certain prior year amounts have been 
reclassified&#13;to conform with the current year 
presentation.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These financial statements should be read in 
conjunction with our Annual&#13;Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 
31, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Name Change 
and Reverse Stock Split &lt;/i&gt;&amp;#150;&#13;Effective July 17, 2015, the 
Company changed its name from Caprock Oil, Inc. to Stack-it Storage, Inc. and 
completed a 1-for-10&#13;reverse split of its Common 
Stock.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Accordingly, all Common Stock share and per share 
amounts in the consolidated financial&#13;statements have been retroactively 
adjusted to reflect the reverse stock split.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Following the 
sale of a substantial&#13;portion of the Company&amp;#146;s oil and gas 
properties to another company in May 2015 (see Note 2), the Company expects to 
continue&#13;to maintain ownership of its remaining oil and gas properties for 
the foreseeable future while it also plans to seek new 
business&#13;opportunities as an owner and operator of self-storage 
facilities.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recently 
Issued Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; In the six months 
ended June 30, 2015, the Financial Accounting Standards Board issued several new
Accounting Standards&#13;Updates which the Company believes will have little or 
no applicability to the Company.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <ROKO:SalesOfOilGasProperties contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In May 2015, the 
Company sold all of its working interests in three&#13;operated oil and gas 
fields in Texas to another oil and gas company.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The cash 
sales price received at closing was $3,100,000,&#13;which is subject to a post-
closing adjustment for the net revenues and expenditures attributable to the 
properties in the period&#13;from the effective date, January 1, 2015, to the 
closing date.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In July, 2015, the amount of the post-closing 
adjustment&#13;was determined by mutual agreement of both parties to be less 
than $5,000.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The net proceeds of this sale 
were&#13;largely used to pay off the Company&amp;#146;s long term debt (see Note
7).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Asset retirement obligations of $383,895 were&#13;assumed
by the buyer and other liabilities in the amount of $653,330 were reduced in 
this sale.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;No gain or loss was&#13;recognized on this 
sale.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In January 2015, the Company sold its non-
operated working interest&#13;in a producing oil field in Texas to the company 
which is the operator of the field (see Note 11).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The cash 
sales price&#13;was $500,000, subject to adjustments for unpaid revenues and 
expenditures incurred through the effective date, January 1, 
2015.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;After&#13;taking such adjustments into account, the 
Company received net cash proceeds from the sale in the amount of approximately 
$261,000.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;No&#13;gain or loss was recognized on this
sale.&lt;/p&gt;</ROKO:SalesOfOilGasProperties>
    <us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial statements have been 
prepared&#13;on a going concern basis, which contemplates the realization of 
assets and satisfaction of liabilities in the normal course of&#13;business. The
Company has reported net losses from operations in the last two years and has a 
substantial working capital deficit&#13;as of June 30, 
2015.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These factors, among others, indicate that the Company 
may be unable to continue as a going concern&#13;for a reasonable period of 
time.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The consolidated financial statements do not contain 
any adjustments to reflect the&#13;possible future effects on the classification
of assets or the amounts and classification of liabilities that may result 
should&#13;the Company be unable to continue as a going concern.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock>
    <ROKO:AcquisitionOfCincoNrgLlc contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On March 17, 2014,
the Company completed the acquisition of Cinco&#13;NRG, LLC 
(&amp;#147;Cinco&amp;#148;), a private oil and gas company, which was under 
common control by its majority shareholder.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;Company 
acquired Cinco through the issuance of a total of 4,694,254 shares of its Common
Stock.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As a result of this&#13;transaction, the members of 
Cinco owned approximately 95% of the Company&amp;#146;s total shares of Common 
Stock outstanding at the&#13;date of the acquisition.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In 
conjunction with this transaction, the Company also issued 125,000 shares of its
Common&#13;Stock to an officer of the Company (see Note 
10).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Cinco was formed in April 2013 to acquire working 
interests in specific&#13;oil and gas properties in the States of Texas and 
Alabama.&amp;#160; At the time of the acquisition, Cinco had a small working 
interest&#13;in a producing oil field in Texas and working interests in several 
exploratory prospects in Alabama.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Cinco is now a&#13;wholly-
owned subsidiary of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="margin: 0; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;As noted above, 
the Company and Cinco were both under common control by a majority shareholder 
prior to this&#13;transaction.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Under the accounting rules for
entities under common control, the Company has accounted for 
Cinco&amp;#146;s&#13;operations on a retrospective basis in the 
Company&amp;#146;s consolidated financial statements from the inception of Cinco
in April&#13;2013.&lt;/p&gt;</ROKO:AcquisitionOfCincoNrgLlc>
    <us-gaap:OilAndGasPropertiesTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In the 
six months ended June 30, 2015, the Company recorded a total&#13;non-cash 
impairment allowance to the carrying value of its oil and gas properties in the 
amount of $1,395,224 (of this amount,&#13;$397,300 was recorded in the three 
months ended June 30, 2015, while the remaining $997,924 was recorded in the 
three months ended&#13;March 31, 2015).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Such adjustments 
resulted from applying the quarterly &amp;#147;ceiling test&amp;#148; 
limitations under&#13;the full cost accounting rules during a period of rapidly 
declining oil prices.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These rules limit the capitalized 
costs&#13;of evaluated properties to the aggregate of the &amp;#147;estimated 
present value,&amp;#148; discounted at a 10-percent interest rate,&#13;of future
net revenues from proved reserves, based on current economic and operating 
conditions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0; font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;As of June 30, 2015, the Company has 
exploratory projects with capitalized costs of $214,018 that were 
reflected&#13;in unevaluated properties (such amount excludes the costs of 
exploratory projects of $923,115, which were transferred to 
evaluated&#13;properties in the six months ended June 30, 
2015).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Capitalized costs of the remaining projects have not 
been evaluated,&#13;therefore, no related depreciation, depletion and 
amortization expense was recorded as of June 30, 2015.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;An 
evaluation&#13;of these projects is largely expected to be completed by December
31, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:OilAndGasPropertiesTextBlock>
    <ROKO:CreditorSettlements contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In June 2015, the 
Company reached agreements with&#13;various unsecured creditors to settle 
outstanding payable balances at substantially discounted amounts from the 
recorded&#13;liabilities in exchange for immediate payments of the discounted 
amounts.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In accordance with such agreements, the&#13;Company 
settled total liabilities at recorded amounts of $910,401 for a total discount 
of $523,815. Accordingly, the Company&#13;recognized a gain on the creditor 
settlements in the amount of $523,815 in the six months ended June 
30,&#13;2015.&lt;/p&gt;</ROKO:CreditorSettlements>

&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="padding-bottom:

&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td nowrap="nowrap" style="padding-bottom: 
3pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Borrowings under the bank credit agreement secured 
by the oil and&#13;gas properties of our legacy subsidiaries, CYMRI, LLC 
(&amp;#147;CYMRI&amp;#148;) and Triumph Energy, Inc. 
(&amp;#147;Triumph&amp;#148;), were&#13;subject to a borrowing base, dependent 
on oil and gas reserves.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;On January 1, 2015, the credit 
agreement expired and&#13;the outstanding borrowings of $1,286,000 became due 
and payable, however, the Company did not make such payment at that time 
and&#13;was in default of the credit agreement.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company 
continued to make monthly interest payments on the outstanding borrowings&#13;at
the default rate of interest in the first quarter of 
2015.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Upon closing of the sale of CYMRI&amp;#146;s producing 
oil&#13;and gas properties on May 20, 2015 (see Note 2), the Company fully 
repaid all outstanding borrowings under the credit agreement&#13;and the credit 
agreement was terminated.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In October 2014, 
the Company implemented a &amp;#147;bridge loan&amp;#148;&#13;program whereby it
made short term borrowings from a group of individual 
lenders.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;By May 2015, such borrowings had 
reached&#13;$820,000, of which $220,000 was from related parties (see Note 11). 
Amounts advanced under the bridge loan program accrued interest&#13;at the rate 
of 15% per annum, with the principal due in one year and a prepayment penalty 
due in the event of early payment (payable&#13;in cash or 
stock).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The bridge lenders were granted a subordinated
security interest in the Company&amp;#146;s 
assets.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Upon&#13;closing of the sale of a small producing 
property in January 2015 (see Note 2), the Company made a partial payment to the
bridge&#13;lenders in the principal amount of $100,000 and also paid prepayment 
penalties consisting of cash of $9,273 and 520 shares of 
Common&#13;Stock.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Upon closing of the sale of 
CYMRI&amp;#146;s producing oil and gas properties on May 20, 2015 (see Note 2), 
the&#13;Company fully repaid all then outstanding bridge loans in the principal 
amount of $820,000 and paid cash prepayment penalties in&#13;the amount of 
$88,061.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In June 2015, the Company re-borrowed 
$125,000 from an entity affiliated&#13;with a major shareholder under the same 
loan program, but with an equity conversion feature, in anticipation of near 
term capital&#13;needs in the self-storage business (see Notes 1 and 
13).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This convertible note payable was evaluated to determine
whether&#13;it had a beneficial conversion feature or the characteristics of a 
derivative and was determined to have neither.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:LongTermDebtTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="margin: 0; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;In June 
2015, the Company received a refund from the Internal Revenue Service 
(&amp;#147;IRS&amp;#148;) for overpayment&#13;of income taxes on its 2008 
consolidated federal income tax return in the amount of 
$61,492.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This refund resulted from&#13;the settlement of an 
IRS audit of the Company&amp;#146;s 2008 consolidated federal income tax 
return.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company had not&#13;previously recorded a tax 
benefit for such a refund.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Accordingly, the Company 
recognized a current income tax benefit&#13;for the amount of this income tax 
refund in the six months ended June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-
06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Basic
income or loss per common share is computed by dividing the&#13;net income or 
loss by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during
the period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Diluted income&#13;or loss per common share is 
computed by dividing net income or loss by the weighted average number of shares
of common stock outstanding&#13;during the period and potentially dilutive 
common share equivalents, consisting of stock options and warrants, under the 
Treasury&#13;Stock Method. The effects of potential common stock equivalents are
not included in computations when their effect is anti-
dilutive.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In&#13;the three month and six month periods ended 
June 30, 2015 and 2014, there were no dilutive common stock equivalents 
reflected in&#13;the determination of net loss per share as the effect would 
have been anti-dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="margin: 0; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On June 30, 2014, 
the Company closed a private equity offering with three accredited investors for
the sale&#13;of 25,000 Units with each Unit comprised of two shares of Common 
Stock and a Warrant to purchase one share of Common Stock, at&#13;an offering 
price of $20.00 per Unit, resulting in gross proceeds of 
$500,000.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Through July 17, 2015, the Company had a stock-based
compensation&#13;plan which was approved by the stockholders in October 2005 and
amended in October 2006.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Under this plan, which 
was&#13;scheduled to expire in October 2015, a maximum of 24,000 shares could be
awarded to directors, employees and consultants in the&#13;form of grants of 
stock or stock options with underlying registration 
rights.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The terms and other conditions applicable&#13;to each
such grant were generally determined by the Board of 
Directors.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Effective July 17, 2015, this plan was 
replaced&#13;by a new shareholder approved compensation plan, with substantially
the same features, under which a maximum of 2,000,000 shares&#13;may be awarded 
to directors, employees and consultants in the form of stock related grants 
(with certain annual and per person&#13;limitations).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Pursuant to the terms of the October 2005 stock-
based compensation&#13;plan, the Company made a grant of 24,000 freely tradable 
shares of Common Stock in March 2014 to a consultant who performed 
certain&#13;services for the Company.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Based on quoted prices 
for the Company&amp;#146;s stock, the Company calculated the value of&#13;such 
issued shares at $132,000 and recorded an expense of that amount in the six 
months ended June 30, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In conjunction with the acquisition of Cinco, the 
Company issued&#13;125,000 shares of restricted Common Stock to an officer of 
the Company in March 2014 (see Note 4).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The restricted 
shares&#13;will vest over a three year period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Based on 
quoted prices for the Company&amp;#146;s stock, the Company calculated 
the&#13;value of such issued shares at $687,500 and will amortize that total 
amount of expense over a three year period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;During&#13;the 
six months ended June 30, 2015 and 2014, the Company recorded amortized expense 
in the amounts of $114,584 and $76,388, respectively,&#13;for this 
grant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In May 2014, the Company engaged a new Chief 
Executive Officer and&#13;granted him non-registered options to acquire 200,000 
shares of Common Stock at an exercise price of $6.50 per share, which 
was&#13;equal to the quoted price of its Common Stock on the date of the 
grant.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Of these options, 20,000 shares vested 
immediately&#13;and the remaining 180,000 shares will vest ratably over a three 
year period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The estimated fair value of the option&#13;was 
calculated using a Black Scholes option pricing model based on the following 
assumptions: (a) Computed volatility &amp;#150; 187%;&#13;(b) Expected risk free
interest rate &amp;#150; 1.6%; (c) Expected dividend yield &amp;#150; zero; (d) 
Expected option term &amp;#150; 4.4&#13;years, calculated pursuant to ASC 718-
10; and (e) Forfeitures &amp;#150; 0%, subject to adjustment for actual 
experience.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;On&#13;the basis of these assumptions, the 
Company calculated the value of such options at $1,238,000 and will amortize 
that total amount&#13;of expense over a three year 
period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;During the six months ended June 30, 2015 and 2014, 
the Company recorded amortized&#13;expense in the amounts of $185,700 and 
$162,300, respectively, for this grant.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The intrinsic value 
of such non-registered&#13;options is zero and there are no other options 
currently outstanding.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="margin: 0; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;For the grants 
summarized above, the Company recorded aggregate stock compensation expense in 
the amounts&#13;of $300,284 and $370,688, respectively, in the six month periods
ended June 30, 2015 and 2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of June 30, 2015,&#13;the 
Company has total future unrecognized compensation expense in the amount of 
$1,062,847.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-
01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin:
0"&gt;A member of the Company&amp;#146;s Board of Directors is the 
president&#13;of a private oil and gas company which has a substantial number of
oil and gas properties in Texas and 
Louisiana.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Cinco&#13;owned a 10% working interest in a 
producing field in Texas operated by this company (through January 2015) and 
also participated&#13;for a 5% working interest in the drilling of an 
unsuccessful well operated by this company in Louisiana in July 
2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In&#13;both instances, this company billed Cinco for 
its share of the capital and operating costs of the properties under a standard
industry&#13;joint operating agreement.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Cinco&amp;#146;s 
resulting accounts payable balance with this company in the amount of 
$217,724&#13;at December 31, 2014, was repaid in conjunction with the sale 
transaction in January 2015 (see Note 2).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Through May 20, 2015, the Company received short-term 
bridge loans from entities affiliated with a major shareholder&#13;in the amount
of $220,000, which were repaid on that date (see Note 7).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In 
June 2015, the Company re-borrowed $125,000&#13;from one of these entities in 
anticipation of near term capital needs in the self-storage business (see Notes 
1 and 13).&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;From time to time the Company may become involved in
litigation in&#13;the ordinary course of business.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At the 
present time, other than the Company&amp;#146;s disclosures below, the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;management is not aware of any such litigation or other 
legal proceedings that could have a material adverse effect on its 
results&#13;of operations, cash flows or financial 
condition.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Triumph Energy, 
Inc., a current subsidiary, and a former subsidiary&#13;which was sold in 2008, 
were named as joint defendants in several lawsuits involving professional 
liability and other matters arising&#13;in the normal course of business in the 
State of Louisiana, most of which were settled at no net cost to 
Triumph.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At&#13;present, there is only one such remaining 
case which is expected to be settled shortly at no net cost to 
Triumph.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Accordingly,&#13;the Company has recorded no loss 
provision as of June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In October 2008, 
an insurer for the Company&amp;#146;s inactive Construction&#13;Staffing 
subsidiary filed a lawsuit against the subsidiary alleging default on a premium 
finance obligation in the amount of approximately&#13;$200,000, plus interest 
and attorney&amp;#146;s fees.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company believes that its 
inactive Construction Staffing subsidiary&#13;has a meritorious position in this
matter and has not engaged legal counsel to defend this 
case.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A default judgment&#13;was rendered in favor of the 
plaintiff in January 2011 and the Company has recorded an accrual for the 
subsidiary&amp;#146;s estimated&#13;loss exposure of approximately $100,000 as 
of June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company, as a lessee and 
operator of oil and gas properties,&#13;is subject to various federal, state and
local laws and regulations relating to discharge of materials into, and 
protection of,&#13;the environment. These laws and regulations may, among other 
things, impose liability on the lessee under an oil and gas lease&#13;for the 
cost of pollution clean-up resulting from operations and subject the lessee to 
liability for pollution damages. The Company&#13;maintains insurance coverage, 
which it believes is customary in the industry, although the Company is not 
fully insured against&#13;all environmental risks. The Company is not aware of 
any environmental claims existing as of June 30, 2015, which have not 
been&#13;provided for, covered by insurance or otherwise have a material impact 
on its financial position or results of operations. There&#13;can be no 
assurance, however, that current regulatory requirements will not change, or 
past noncompliance with environmental laws&#13;will not be discovered on the 
Company&amp;#146;s properties.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>

    <ROKO:NameChangeAndReverseStockSplit contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;Effective July 17, 2015, the Company changed&#13;its name from
Caprock Oil, Inc. to Stack-it Storage, Inc. and completed a 1-for-10 reverse 
split of its Common Stock.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Accordingly,&#13;all Common Stock 
share and per share amounts in the consolidated financial statements have been 
retroactively adjusted to reflect&#13;the reverse stock 
split.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Following the sale of a substantial portion of the 
Company&amp;#146;s oil and gas properties to&#13;another company in May 2015 
(see Note 2), the Company expects to continue to maintain ownership of its 
remaining oil and gas properties&#13;for the foreseeable future while it also 
plans to seek new business opportunities as an owner and operator of self-
storage facilities.&lt;/p&gt;</ROKO:NameChangeAndReverseStockSplit>

/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */
/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
background-color: #def;
border: 2px solid #2F4497;
font-size: 1em;
position: absolute;
}
..report table.authRefData a {
display: block;
font-weight: bold;
}
..report table.authRefData p {
margin-top: 0px;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide {
background-color: #2F4497;
padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
text-align: right;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
background-color: #2F4497;
}
..report table.authRefData .body {
height: 150px;
overflow: auto;
width: 400px;
}
..report table.authRefData table{
font-size: 1em;
}
/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
color: black;
text-decoration: none;
}
/* table */
..report {
background-color: white;
border: 2px solid #acf;
clear: both;
color: black;
font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
margin-bottom: 2em;
}
..report hr {
border: 1px solid #acf;
}
/* Top labels */
..report th {
background-color: #acf;
color: black;
font-weight: bold;
text-align: center;
}
..report th.void {
background-color: transparent;
color: #000000;
font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
text-align: left;
}
..report .pl {
text-align: left;
vertical-align: top;
white-space: normal;
width: 200px;
white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}
..report td.pl a.a {
cursor: pointer;
display: block;
width: 200px;
overflow: hidden;
}
..report td.pl div.a {
width: 200px;
}
..report td.pl a:hover {
background-color: #ffc;
}
/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
background-color: #acf;
color: black;
font-weight: bold;
}
/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
background-color: #f0f0f0;
}
/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
background-color: #def;
}
..report .reu td {
border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
background-color: white;
}
..report .rou td {
border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}
/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
white-space: nowrap;
}
/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
text-align: right;
white-space: nowrap;
}
}
..report .nump {
padding-left: 2em;
}
..report .nump {
padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}
/* styles for text types */

}

}

}

<body>
<span style="display: none;">v3.2.0.727</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idm139704827914256">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>4. 
Acquisition of Cinco NRG, LLC<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2015</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_ROKO_AcquisitionOfCincoNrgLlcAbstract', window );"><strong>Acquisition 
Of Cinco Nrg Llc</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl custom" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_ROKO_AcquisitionOfCincoNrgLlc', window );">4. Acquisition of Cinco NRG, 
LLC</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">On March 17, 2014, the Company completed the acquisition of CincoNRG, LLC
(&#147;Cinco&#148;), a private oil and gas company, which was under common 
control by its majority shareholder.&#160;&#160;TheCompany acquired Cinco 
through the issuance of a total of 4,694,254 shares of its Common 
Stock.&#160;&#160;As a result of thistransaction, the members of Cinco owned 
approximately 95% of the Company&#146;s total shares of Common Stock outstanding
at thedate of the acquisition.&#160;&#160;In conjunction with this transaction, 
the Company also issued 125,000 shares of its CommonStock to an officer of the 
Company (see Note 10).&#160;&#160;Cinco was formed in April 2013 to acquire 
working interests in specificoil and gas properties in the States of Texas and 
Alabama.&#160; At the time of the acquisition, Cinco had a small working 
interestin a producing oil field in Texas and working interests in several 
exploratory prospects in Alabama.&#160;&#160;Cinco is now awholly-owned 
subsidiary of the Company.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0">&#160;</p><p style="margin: 0; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif">As noted above, the Company and Cinco were both under common control by a
majority shareholder prior to thistransaction.&#160;&#160;Under the accounting 
rules for entities under common control, the Company has accounted for 
Cinco&#146;soperations on a retrospective basis in the Company&#146;s 
consolidated financial statements from the inception of Cinco in April
2013.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<span style="display: none;">v3.2.0.727</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idm139704616342656">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>3. 
Going Concern<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2015</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_ROKO_GoingConcernAbstract', window );"><strong>Going 
Concern</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock', window );">3. Going 
Concern</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">The accompanying consolidated financial statements have been preparedon a 
going concern basis, which contemplates the realization of assets and 
satisfaction of liabilities in the normal course ofbusiness. The Company has 
reported net losses from operations in the last two years and has a substantial 
working capital deficitas of June 30, 2015.&#160;&#160;These factors, among 
others, indicate that the Company may be unable to continue as a going concern
for a reasonable period of time.&#160;&#160;The consolidated financial 
statements do not contain any adjustments to reflect thepossible future effects 
on the classification of assets or the amounts and classification of liabilities
that may result shouldthe Company be unable to continue as a going 
concern.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_ROKO_GoingConcernAbstract">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure when substantial doubt is raised 
about the ability to continue as a going concern. Includes, but is not limited 
to, principal conditions or events that raised substantial doubt about the 
ability to continue as a going concern, management's evaluation of the 
significance of those conditions or events in relation to the ability to meet 
its obligations, and management's plans that alleviated or are intended to 
mitigate the conditions or events that raise substantial doubt about the ability
to continue as a going concern.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of
obligations incurred through that date and due within one year (or the operating
cycle, if longer), including liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have 
typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received,
and other costs not separately disclosed in the balance sheet that are statutory
in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and 
for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered.</p></div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities
incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to 
vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business. 
Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or 
within the normal operating cycle if longer).</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccountsReceivableNetCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount due from customers or clients, within one year of 
the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), for
goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold
in the normal course of business, reduced to the estimated net realizable fair 
value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain
of collection.</p></div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations
incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are 
incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which 
invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include 
taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used to reflect the current portion of the 
liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if 
longer).</p></div>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Value received from shareholders in common stock-related 
transactions that are in excess of par value or stated value and amounts 
received from other stock-related transactions. Includes only common stock 
transactions (excludes preferred stock transactions). May be called contributed 
capital, capital in excess of par, capital surplus, or paid-in 
capital.</p></div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Noncurrent portion of the carrying amount of a liability 
for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal 
obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived 
asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the
normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of 
lessees.</p></div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits 
obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or 
events.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AssetsCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within
one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Assets are probable future 
economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past 
transactions or events.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly 
liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash 
and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in 
value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable 
common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). 
This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for 
number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts 
are in another section within stockholders' equity.</p></div>

Definition</a><div><p>Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of

the current portion of such liabilities (due within one year or within the 
normal operating cycle if longer).</p></div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all liabilities that are recognized. Liabilities are probable future 
sacrifices of economic benefits arising from present obligations of an entity to
transfer assets or provide services to other entities in the future.</p></div>

<td><strong> Balance Type:</strong></td>
<td>credit</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong> Period Type:</strong></td>
<td>instant</td>
</tr>
</table></div>
</div></td></tr>
</table>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of 
receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which
are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's 
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</p></div>

<span style="display: none;">v3.2.0.727</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idm139704834492704">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>1. 
Basis of Presentation<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2015</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_ROKO_BasisOfPresentationAbstract', 
window );"><strong>BasisOfPresentationAbstract</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock', 
window );">1. Basis of Presentation</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; 
text-indent: 0.5in"><i>Interim Financial Information </i>&#150;The accompanying 
consolidated financial statements have been prepared by Stack-it Storage, Inc., 
formerly, Caprock Oil, Inc. (&#147;we&#148;,&#147;our&#148; or&#160;&#160;the 
&#147;Company&#148;), without audit, in accordance with accounting principles 
generally acceptedin the Unites States of America for interim financial 
information and pursuant to the rules and regulations of the Securities and
Exchange Commission.&#160;&#160;In the opinion of management, these consolidated
financial statements contain all adjustments,consisting only of normal recurring
adjustments, necessary to fairly state the financial position of the Company as 
of June 30,2015, the results of its operations for the three month and six month
periods ended June 30, 2015 and 2014, and cash flows forthe three month and six 
month periods ended June 30, 2015 and 2014.&#160;&#160;Certain prior year 
amounts have been reclassifiedto conform with the current year 
presentation.&#160;&#160;These financial statements should be read in 
conjunction with our AnnualReport on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 
2014.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
indent: 0.5in"><i>Name Change and Reverse Stock Split </i>&#150;Effective July 
17, 2015, the Company changed its name from Caprock Oil, Inc. to Stack-it 
Storage, Inc. and completed a 1-for-10reverse split of its Common 
Stock.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, all Common Stock share and per share amounts in 
the consolidated financialstatements have been retroactively adjusted to reflect
the reverse stock split.&#160;&#160;Following the sale of a substantialportion 
of the Company&#146;s oil and gas properties to another company in May 2015 (see
Note 2), the Company expects to continueto maintain ownership of its remaining 
oil and gas properties for the foreseeable future while it also plans to seek 
new businessopportunities as an owner and operator of self-storage 
facilities.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
indent: 0.5in"><i>Recently Issued Accounting Pronouncements</i>&#150; In the six
months ended June 30, 2015, the Financial Accounting Standards Board issued 
several new Accounting StandardsUpdates which the Company believes will have 
little or no applicability to the Company.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

policies of the reporting entity.</p></div>

remuneration. This may include the value of stock or unit options, amortization 
of restricted stock or units, and adjustment for officers' compensation. As 
noncash, this element is an add back when calculating net cash generated by 
operating activities using the indirect method.</p></div>

<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>20
<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
/**
 * Rivet Software Inc.
 *
 * @copyright Copyright (c) 2006-2011 Rivet Software, Inc. All rights reserved.
 * Version 2.4.0.3
 *
 */
var Show = {};
Show.LastAR = null,
Show.hideAR = function(){
Show.LastAR.style.display = 'none';
};
Show.showAR = function ( link, id, win ){
if( Show.LastAR ){
Show.hideAR();
}
var ref = link;
do {
ref = ref.nextSibling;
} while (ref && ref.nodeName != 'TABLE');
if (!ref || ref.nodeName != 'TABLE') {
var tmp = win ?
win.document.getElementById(id) :
document.getElementById(id);
if( tmp ){
ref = tmp.cloneNode(true);
ref.id = '';
link.parentNode.appendChild(ref);
}
}
if( ref ){
ref.style.display = 'block';
Show.LastAR = ref;
}
};
Show.toggleNext = function( link ){
var ref = link;
do{
ref = ref.nextSibling;
}while( ref.nodeName != 'DIV' );
if( ref.style &&
ref.style.display &&
ref.style.display == 'none' ){
ref.style.display = 'block';
if( link.textContent ){
link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '+', '-' );
}else{
link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '+', '-' );
}
}else{
ref.style.display = 'none';
if( link.textContent ){
link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '-', '+' );
}else{
link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '-', '+' );
}
}
};
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

if
e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
} else

cellspacing="2" id="idm139704787119840">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>2. 
Sales of Oil &amp; Gas Properties<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2015</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_ROKO_SalesOfOilGasPropertiesAbstract', window );"><strong>Sales Of Oil 
Gas Properties</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl custom" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_ROKO_SalesOfOilGasProperties', window );">2. Sales of Oil &amp; Gas 
Properties</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">In May 2015, the Company sold all of its working interests in threeoperated 
oil and gas fields in Texas to another oil and gas company.&#160;&#160;The cash 
sales price received at closing was $3,100,000,which is subject to a post-
closing adjustment for the net revenues and expenditures attributable to the 
properties in the periodfrom the effective date, January 1, 2015, to the closing
date.&#160;&#160;In July, 2015, the amount of the post-closing adjustmentwas 
determined by mutual agreement of both parties to be less than 
$5,000.&#160;&#160;&#160;The net proceeds of this sale werelargely used to pay 
off the Company&#146;s long term debt (see Note 7).&#160;&#160;Asset retirement 
obligations of $383,895 wereassumed by the buyer and other liabilities in the 
amount of $653,330 were reduced in this sale.&#160;&#160;No gain or loss was
recognized on this sale.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">In January 2015, the Company sold its non-operated working interestin a 
producing oil field in Texas to the company which is the operator of the field 
(see Note 11).&#160;&#160;The cash sales pricewas $500,000, subject to 
adjustments for unpaid revenues and expenditures incurred through the effective 
date, January 1, 2015.&#160;&#160;Aftertaking such adjustments into account, the
Company received net cash proceeds from the sale in the amount of approximately 
$261,000.&#160;&#160;Nogain or loss was recognized on this 
sale.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total number of common shares of an entity that have been 
sold or granted to shareholders (includes common shares that were issued, 
repurchased and remain in the treasury). These shares represent capital invested
by the firm's shareholders and owners, and may be all or only a portion of the 
number of shares authorized. Shares issued include shares outstanding and shares
held in the treasury.</p></div>

Definition</a><div><p>Total number of nonredeemable preferred shares (or 
preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) issued to 
shareholders (includes related preferred shares that were issued, repurchased, 
and remain in the treasury). May be all or portion of the number of preferred 
shares authorized. Excludes preferred shares that are classified as 
debt.</p></div>

<body>
<span style="display: none;">v3.2.0.727</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idm139704783451632">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>12. 
Contingencies<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2015</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureAbstract', 
window );"><strong>Commitments and Contingencies Disclosure 
[Abstract]</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock', window );">12. 
Contingencies</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">From time to time the Company may become involved in litigation inthe 
ordinary course of business.&#160;&#160;At the present time, other than the 
Company&#146;s disclosures below, the Company&#146;smanagement is not aware of 
any such litigation or other legal proceedings that could have a material 
adverse effect on its resultsof operations, cash flows or financial 
condition.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; 
text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0">Triumph Energy, Inc., a current subsidiary, and a former subsidiary
which was sold in 2008, were named as joint defendants in several lawsuits 
involving professional liability and other matters arisingin the normal course 
of business in the State of Louisiana, most of which were settled at no net cost
to Triumph.&#160;&#160;Atpresent, there is only one such remaining case which is
expected to be settled shortly at no net cost to 
Triumph.&#160;&#160;Accordingly,the Company has recorded no loss provision as of
June 30, 2015.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In 
October 2008, an insurer for the Company&#146;s inactive ConstructionStaffing 
subsidiary filed a lawsuit against the subsidiary alleging default on a premium 
finance obligation in the amount of approximately$200,000, plus interest and 
attorney&#146;s fees.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that its inactive 
Construction Staffing subsidiaryhas a meritorious position in this matter and 
has not engaged legal counsel to defend this case.&#160;&#160;A default judgment
was rendered in favor of the plaintiff in January 2011 and the Company has 
recorded an accrual for the subsidiary&#146;s estimatedloss exposure of 
approximately $100,000 as of June 30, 2015.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0">The Company, as a lessee and operator of oil and gas 
properties,is subject to various federal, state and local laws and regulations 
relating to discharge of materials into, and protection of,the environment. 
These laws and regulations may, among other things, impose liability on the 
lessee under an oil and gas leasefor the cost of pollution clean-up resulting 
from operations and subject the lessee to liability for pollution damages. The 
Companymaintains insurance coverage, which it believes is customary in the 
industry, although the Company is not fully insured againstall environmental 
risks. The Company is not aware of any environmental claims existing as of June 
30, 2015, which have not beenprovided for, covered by insurance or otherwise 
have a material impact on its financial position or results of operations. There
can be no assurance, however, that current regulatory requirements will not 
change, or past noncompliance with environmental lawswill not be discovered on 
the Company&#146;s properties.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

</table></div>

converted into 10,416,667 shares ofthe Company&#146;s restricted Common Stock 
(see Notes 7 and 11).&#160;&#160;</p><span></span>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_EarningsPerShareBasicAndDiluted">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The amount of net income or loss for the period per each 
share in instances when basic and diluted earnings per share are the same amount
and reported as a single line item on the face of the financial statements.  
Basic earnings per share is the amount of net income or loss for the period per 
each share of common stock or unit outstanding during the reporting period.  
Diluted earnings per share includes the amount of net income or loss for the 
period available to each share of common stock or common unit outstanding during
the reporting period and to each share or unit that would have been outstanding 
assuming the issuance of common shares or units for all dilutive potential 
common shares or units outstanding during the reporting period.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>No definition available.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0"

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The amount of interest income and other income recognized 
during the period. Included in this element is interest derived from investments
in debt securities, cash and cash equivalents, and other investments which 
reflect the time value of money or transactions in which the payments are for 
the use or forbearance of money and other income from ancillary business-related
activities (that is, excluding major activities considered part of the normal 
operations of the business).</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>No definition available.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_SellingGeneralAndAdministrativeExpense">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The aggregate total costs related to selling a firm's 
product and services, as well as all other general and administrative expenses. 
Direct selling expenses (for example, credit, warranty, and advertising) are 
expenses that can be directly linked to the sale of specific products. Indirect 
selling expenses are expenses that cannot be directly linked to the sale of 
specific products, for example telephone expenses, Internet, and postal charges.
General and administrative expenses include salaries of non-sales personnel, 
rent, utilities, communication, etc.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br><br><br> -Publisher 
FASB<br><br><br><br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br><br><br> 
-Topic 225<br><br><br><br> -SubTopic 10<br><br><br><br> -Section 
S99<br><br><br><br> -Paragraph 2<br><br><br><br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-
03.4)<br><br><br><br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=26872669&amp;loc=d3e20235-
122688<br><br><br><br>Reference 2: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br><br><br> -Publisher 
FASB<br><br><br><br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br><br><br> 
-Topic 330<br><br><br><br> -SubTopic 10<br><br><br><br> -Section 
30<br><br><br><br> -Paragraph 8<br><br><br><br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=51677171&amp;loc=d3e3636-
108311<br><br><br><br></p></div>

<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a"

href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_LongTermDebtTextBlock', window );">7. Long Term Debt</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">As of June 30, 2015 and December 31, 2014, the Company had the followinglong-
term debt obligations:</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0">&#160;</p><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%"><tr style="vertical-align: bottom"> 
<td>&#160;</td>    <td>&#160;</td>    <td colspan="2" style="text-align: 
center"><font style="font-size: 8pt"><b>June 30,</b></font></td>    <td 
nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>    <td>&#160;</td>    <td colspan="2" style="text-
align: center"><font style="font-size: 8pt"><b>December 31,</b></font></td>    
<td nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td></tr><tr style="vertical-align: bottom">    <td 
style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt">&#160;</td>    <td style="padding-bottom: 
1.5pt">&#160;</td>    <td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; 
text-align: center"><font style="font-size: 8pt"><b>2015</b></font></td>    <td 
nowrap="nowrap" style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt">&#160;</td>    <td style="padding-
bottom: 1.5pt">&#160;</td>    <td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt 
solid; text-align: center"><font style="font-size: 8pt"><b>2014</b></font></td> 
<td nowrap="nowrap" style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt">&#160;</td></tr><tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF">    <td style="width: 
78%"><font style="font-size: 8pt">$25,000,000 line of credit with a bank, 
maturing on January 1, 2015, default interest rate at 5.0% above prime, payable 
monthly, secured by first lien on CYMRI, LLC&#146;s oil and gas 
properties</font></td>    <td style="width: 1%; text-align: right">&#160;</td>  
<td style="width: 1%"><font style="font-size: 8pt">$</font></td>    <td

style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt; text-align: right">&#160;</td>    <td 
style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid">&#160;</td>    <td style="border-

1.5pt"><font style="font-size: 8pt">)</font></td></tr><tr style="vertical-align:
bottom; background-color: white">    <td>&#160;</td>    <td>&#160;</td>    
<td>&#160;</td>    <td style="text-align: right">&#160;</td>    <td 
nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>    <td>&#160;</td>    <td>&#160;</td>    <td 
style="text-align: right">&#160;</td>    <td nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td></tr><tr
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF">    <td 
style="padding-bottom: 3pt"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;Long term debt, net of current portion</font></td>    <td style="padding-
bottom: 3pt; text-align: right">&#160;</td>    <td style="border-bottom: black 
2.25pt double"><font style="font-size: 8pt">$</font></td>    <td style="border-
bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">-
</font></td>    <td nowrap="nowrap" style="padding-bottom: 3pt">&#160;</td>    
<td style="padding-bottom: 3pt; text-align: right">&#160;</td>    <td 
style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">$</font></td>    <td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">-</font></td>    <td nowrap="nowrap" 
style="padding-bottom: 3pt">&#160;</td></tr></table><p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p><p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Borrowings under the 
bank credit agreement secured by the oil andgas properties of our legacy 
subsidiaries, CYMRI, LLC (&#147;CYMRI&#148;) and Triumph Energy, Inc. 
(&#147;Triumph&#148;), weresubject to a borrowing base, dependent on oil and gas
reserves.&#160;&#160;On January 1, 2015, the credit agreement expired andthe 
outstanding borrowings of $1,286,000 became due and payable, however, the 
Company did not make such payment at that time andwas in default of the credit 
agreement.&#160;&#160;The Company continued to make monthly interest payments on
the outstanding borrowingsat the default rate of interest in the first quarter 
of 2015.&#160;&#160;Upon closing of the sale of CYMRI&#146;s producing oiland 
gas properties on May 20, 2015 (see Note 2), the Company fully repaid all 
outstanding borrowings under the credit agreementand the credit agreement was 
terminated.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In 
October 2014, the Company implemented a &#147;bridge loan&#148;program whereby 
it made short term borrowings from a group of individual lenders.&#160;&#160;By 
May 2015, such borrowings had reached$820,000, of which $220,000 was from 
related parties (see Note 11). Amounts advanced under the bridge loan program 
accrued interestat the rate of 15% per annum, with the principal due in one year
and a prepayment penalty due in the event of early payment (payablein cash or 
stock).&#160;&#160;The bridge lenders were granted a subordinated security 
interest in the Company&#146;s assets.&#160;&#160;Uponclosing of the sale of a 
small producing property in January 2015 (see Note 2), the Company made a 
partial payment to the bridgelenders in the principal amount of $100,000 and 
also paid prepayment penalties
 consisting of cash of $9,273 and 520 shares of CommonStock.&#160;&#160;Upon 
closing of the sale of CYMRI&#146;s producing oil and gas properties on May 20,
2015 (see Note 2), theCompany fully repaid all then outstanding bridge loans in 
the principal amount of $820,000 and paid cash prepayment penalties inthe amount
of $88,061.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In 
June 2015, the Company re-borrowed $125,000 from an entity affiliatedwith a 
major shareholder under the same loan program, but with an equity conversion 
feature, in anticipation of near term capitalneeds in the self-storage business 
(see Notes 1 and 13).&#160;&#160;This convertible note payable was evaluated to 
determine whetherit had a beneficial conversion feature or the characteristics 
of a derivative and was determined to have neither.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

0">In June 2015, the Company reached agreements withvarious unsecured creditors 
to settle outstanding payable balances at substantially discounted amounts from 
the recordedliabilities in exchange for immediate payments of the discounted 
amounts.&#160;&#160;In accordance with such agreements, theCompany settled total
liabilities at recorded amounts of $910,401 for a total discount of $523,815. 
Accordingly, the Companyrecognized a gain on the creditor settlements in the 
amount of $523,815 in the six months ended June 30,2015.</p><span></span>

<FILENAME>R19.htm

<body>
<span style="display: none;">v3.2.0.727</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idm139704612135376">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>1. 
Basis of Presentation (Policies)<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2015</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this,
'defref_ROKO_BasisOfPresentationPoliciesAbstract', window );"><strong>Basis Of 
Presentation Policies</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl custom" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_ROKO_InterimFinancialInformation', window );">Interim Financial 
Information</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; 
text-indent: 0.5in">The accompanying consolidated financial statementshave been 
prepared by Stack-it Storage, Inc., formerly, Caprock Oil, Inc. (&#147;we&#148;,
&#147;our&#148; or&#160;&#160;the&#147;Company&#148;), without audit, in 
accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the Unites States of
Americafor interim financial information and pursuant to the rules and 
regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160;&#160;Inthe opinion 
of management, these consolidated financial statements contain all adjustments, 
consisting only of normal recurringadjustments, necessary to fairly state the 
financial position of the Company as of June 30, 2015, the results of its 
operationsfor the three month and six month periods ended June 30, 2015 and 
2014, and cash flows for the three month and six month periodsended June 30, 
2015 and 2014.&#160;&#160;Certain prior year amounts have been reclassified to 
conform with the current year presentation.&#160;&#160;Thesefinancial statements
should be read in conjunction with our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year 
ended December 31, 2014.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl custom" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_ROKO_NameChangeAndReverseStockSplit', window );">Name Change and Reverse
Stock Split</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; 
text-indent: 0.5in">Effective July 17, 2015, the Company changedits name from 
Caprock Oil, Inc. to Stack-it Storage, Inc. and completed a 1-for-10 reverse 
split of its Common Stock.&#160;&#160;Accordingly,all Common Stock share and per
share amounts in the consolidated financial statements have been retroactively 
adjusted to reflectthe reverse stock split.&#160;&#160;Following the sale of a 
substantial portion of the Company&#146;s oil and gas properties toanother 
company in May 2015 (see Note 2), the Company expects to continue to maintain 
ownership of its remaining oil and gas propertiesfor the foreseeable future 
while it also plans to seek new business opportunities as an owner and operator 
of self-storage facilities.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock', window );">Recently 
Issued Accounting Pronouncements</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; 
text-indent: 0.5in">In the six months ended June 30, 2015, the Financial
Accounting Standards Board issued several new Accounting Standards Updates which
the Company believes will have little or no applicabilityto the 
Company.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_ROKO_BasisOfPresentationPoliciesAbstract">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
References</a><div><p>No definition available.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0">

<head>
<title></title>
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="report.css">
<script type="text/javascript" src="Show.js">/* Do Not Remove This Comment

(e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {

<body>
<span style="display: none;">v3.2.0.727</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idm139704788434096">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>10. 
Stock-Based Compensation<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">6 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2015</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsSharebasedPaymentsAbstract', 
window );"><strong>Disclosure of Compensation Related Costs, Share-based 
Payments [Abstract]</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock', 
window );">10. Stock-Based Compensation</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">Through July 17, 2015, the Company had a stock-based compensationplan which 
was approved by the stockholders in October 2005 and amended in October 
2006.&#160;&#160;Under this plan, which wasscheduled to expire in October 2015,
a maximum of 24,000 shares could be awarded to directors, employees and 
consultants in theform of grants of stock or stock options with underlying 
registration rights.&#160;&#160;The terms and other conditions applicableto each
such grant were generally determined by the Board of 
Directors.&#160;&#160;Effective July 17, 2015, this plan was replacedby a new 
shareholder approved compensation plan, with substantially the same features, 
under which a maximum of 2,000,000 sharesmay be awarded to directors, employees 
and consultants in the form of stock related grants (with certain annual and per
personlimitations).</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0">Pursuant to the terms of the October 2005 stock-based 
compensationplan, the Company made a grant of 24,000 freely tradable shares of 
Common Stock in March 2014 to a consultant who performed certainservices for the
Company.&#160;&#160;Based on quoted prices for the Company&#146;s stock, the 
Company calculated the value ofsuch issued shares at $132,000 and recorded an 
expense of that amount in the six months ended June 30, 2014.</p><p style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p><p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In conjunction with 
the acquisition of Cinco, the Company issued125,000 shares of restricted Common 
Stock to an officer of the Company in March 2014 (see Note 4).&#160;&#160;The 
restricted shareswill vest over a three year period.&#160;&#160;Based on quoted 
prices for the Company&#146;s stock, the Company calculated thevalue of such 
issued shares at $687,500 and will amortize that total amount of expense over a 
three year period.&#160;&#160;Duringthe six months ended June 30, 2015 and 2014,
the Company recorded amortized expense in the amounts of $114,584 and $76,388, 
respectively,for this grant.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0">&#160;</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0">In May 2014, the Company engaged a new Chief Executive Officer and
granted him non-registered options to acquire 200,000 shares of Common Stock at 
an exercise price of $6.50 per share, which wasequal to the quoted price of its 
Common Stock on the date of the grant.&#160;&#160;Of these options, 20,000 
shares vested immediatelyand the remaining 180,000 shares will vest ratably over
a three year period.&#160;&#160;The estimated fair value of the optionwas 
calculated using a Black Scholes option pricing model based on the following 
assumptions: (a) Computed volatility &#150; 187%;(b) Expected risk free interest
rate &#150; 1.6%; (c) Expected dividend yield &#150; zero; (d) Expected option 
term &#150; 4.4years, calculated pursuant to ASC 718-10; and (e) Forfeitures 
&#150; 0%, subject to adjustment for actual experience.&#160;&#160;Onthe basis 
of these assumptions, the Company calculated the value of such options at 
$1,238,000 and will amortize that total amountof expense over a three year 
period.&#160;&#160;During the six months ended June 30, 2015 and 2014, the 
Company recorded amortizedexpense in the amounts of $185,700 and $162,300, 
respectively, for this grant.&#160;&#160;The intrinsic value of such non-
registeredoptions is zero and there are no other options currently 
outstanding.</p><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0">&#160;</p><p style="margin: 0; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">For 
the grants summarized above, the Company recorded aggregate stock compensation 
expense in the amountsof $300,284 and $370,688, respectively, in the six month 
periods ended June 30, 2015 and 2014.&#160;&#160;As of June 30, 2015,the Company
has total future unrecognized compensation expense in the amount of 
$1,062,847.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="display: none;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for compensation-related costs for 
equity-based compensation, which may include disclosure of policies,
compensation plan details, allocation of equity compensation, incentive 
distributions, equity-based arrangements to obtain goods and services, deferred 
compensation arrangements, employee stock ownership plan details and employee 
stock purchase plan details.</p></div>
